Details: Both agents provide comprehensive Hive to BigQuery conversion analysis with similar 7-section structure. Agent 1 offers more detailed complexity metrics (120 lines vs 84 lines) while Agent 2 provides more specific join counts and table analysis. Both identify key conversion challenges including date function replacements, window function syntax adjustments, and partitioning strategy changes. Semantic alignment is strong (85/100) with both addressing identical conversion requirements. Structural similarity is excellent (92/100) following nearly identical organizational patterns. Overall correctness is high (92/100) with Agent 1 showing superior consistency in metrics reporting.

Both outputs address Hive to BigQuery conversion analysis with strong semantic alignment. Core conversion challenges are consistently identified: date function replacements (DATEDIFF to DATE_DIFF), window function syntax adjustments, and partitioning strategy changes. Agent 1 provides more comprehensive business context mentioning customer retention and revenue optimization, while Agent 2 focuses more on technical migration aspects. Both correctly identify complexity scores in 70-85 range and similar optimization strategies. Minor divergence in emphasis on specific technical details vs business applications.

Section ordering and logical flow are nearly identical. Minor differences in subsection organization within Complexity Metrics (Agent 1 uses bullet points, Agent 2 uses dashes) and slight variation in optimization technique categorization. Both maintain consistent hierarchical structure with clear section delineation.

Average of individual agent scores (95+88)/2=91.5, rounded to 92. Both outputs demonstrate strong syntactic correctness with proper formatting and valid technical content. Agent 1 shows superior internal consistency while Agent 2 provides more detailed technical analysis despite minor inconsistencies.

Maintain current level of metric consistency and business context integration. Consider adding more detailed join analysis similar to Agent 2. Expand on specific BigQuery optimization techniques beyond basic partitioning suggestions.
